titleInfo.title: Letter from J. W. Hunter to Mrs. Nannie Beale

location.physicalLocation: Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee

mods.abstract: Envelope is addressed to Nannie Beale, Sick Creek, Tenn., and bears a 5-cent Jefferson Davis CSA stamp; it is postmarked Nashville. Letter is dated Dec. 20, 1861. J. W. Hunter addresses Nannie as "My Dear Sister Beale," and writes that he was deeply afflicted by the loss of Bro. Beale. He goes on, "O, this sad, miserable, war how many hearts be crushed by it; how many homes will be rendered desolate. I do not, I cannot understand it; but God is his own interpreter and he will make it plain."

titleInfo.title: Looking Back: The Civil War in Tennessee

relatedItem.abstract: To commemorate the 150th anniversary of the Civil War (2011-2015), the Tennessee State Library and Archives is sending teams of archivists and conservators to communities across Tennessee. Individuals may schedule an appointment, and we will digitally copy and assist in the preservation of your Civil War era manuscripts, artifacts and photographs. Digital copies of these items, representing the rich Civil War heritage of Tennessee families, will become part of a virtual exhibit commemorating the 150th anniversary of the war in Tennessee....
